speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles!

speaker: Niles
text: [_to counter waiter_] Double latte, full fat, chocolate shavings.

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah, the self-pity special.

speaker: Niles
text: I've had a hellish week.  To top it all off, old Reggie Belknap, the president of our wine club, kicked the bucket. The man's body was not even properly chilled before the club jackals began angling to succeed him.  You've never seen such vicious, cutthroat conniving!

speaker: Frasier
text: Who's winning?

speaker: Niles
text: Well, Maris, of course, but just barely.  Matthew Pym tried to stage a coup!  Fortunately, Maris has photos she took at his wedding -- photos that clearly show the label on the champagne he served.

speaker: Frasier
text: Domestic?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh-ho-ho-ho, not just domestic.  From... Connecticut. _Niles sees Bebe Glaser enter the Caf e and hang up her coat. _

speaker: Niles
text: Oh dear, don't turn around.  It's that dreadful woman who works for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Who?

speaker: Niles
text: Um, uh... Lady MacBeth without the sincerity?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!  Oh, Bebe's here!  Oh, yes. [_stands and pulls up another chair_] Now, listen Niles, I care for her just as little as you do, but she is a terrific agent, which is why I overlook the fact that she's pushy and obnoxious and the most appalling phony I've ever known. [_turns around_] Bebe, darling, how are you! _Frasier and Bebe throw their arms open and kiss each other's cheeks. They sit at the table._

speaker: Bebe
text: My poor wounded baby!  I just heard what those misers you work for are trying to do to you!  Well, don't you worry, they're not going to get away with it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you must have heard wrong, Bebe.  They extended my contract for another year with an eight-percent raise.

speaker: Bebe
text: Eight percent?  That would insult even a waiter! [_to a passing waiter_] Double cappuccino -- move it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, Bebe, that is what my contract calls for.

speaker: Bebe
text: A slave contract you negotiated two years ago before you even had an agent!  They took advantage of your inexperience.

speaker: Frasier
text: I thought it was a very generous offer.

speaker: Bebe
text: Oh please, do you have any idea how hot you are?  I get offers every day from other stations, offering the moon for you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Good lord, am I really that hot?

speaker: Bebe
text: Are you kidding?  If I were a pot roast... I'd be done.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, I'm Niles, a person at the table.

speaker: Bebe
text: Niles, thank God you're here!  Back me up, give him some sound brotherly advice.

speaker: Niles
text: She's the Devil, Frasier.  Run fast, run far.

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen Bebe, I realize that the station is making a handsome profit on my show, but what can I do?  I do have a contract.

speaker: Bebe
text: No, darling, what you have is a... fever.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Bebe
text: Ooh, you're like a furnace!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you know, I-I think I see where you're going with this, Bebe, and I'm not sure how I feel about it.

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, how do you feel about being one of the lowest paid personalities at the station?

speaker: Frasier
text: Who makes more?

speaker: Bebe
text: Who doesn't?  Nanette from "Pet Chat," The Happy Chef -- oh, for heaven's sakes, Father Mike could buy and sell you!

speaker: Frasier
text: Father Mike?  He took a vow of poverty!

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, now he's taking a cruise.

speaker: Bebe
text: Oh, that big strapping chest of yours is all congested. You just say the word, and I'll tell the station you have some coughing up to do... and so do they.

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, this fever of mine... how much higher do you think it might go?

speaker: Bebe
text: I'm guessing... thirty to forty percent above where it is now.

speaker: Niles
text: _Forty_ percent?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what can I say but, uh... Ah-choo!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, thank you. **FRASIER CRANE, MAMBO KING** _Scene Two -- Frasier's Apartment Frasier, dressed in a casual striped shirt -- no tie -- is sitting on the couch next to Daphne, who is watching a daytime soap opera. Martin is reading the paper in his Armchair.  On the TV:_ Man: Child, you wanted me to make you pregnant! Woman: I was in a coma, you might have waited.

speaker: Frasier
text: My God, let's see, they've got Sky, Zena, and Slate.

speaker: Daphne
text: I don't think someone called Frasier should be pointing any fingers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Is this how you spend your days when I'm not at home?

speaker: Daphne
text: Not quite.  When you're not home I can bloody well hear what they're saying.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you wouldn't want to miss a line of this dialogue. "Oh, Zirconia, can't you see Stone doesn't love you? He loves Placenta!"

speaker: Martin
text: My favorite are the villains.  They have one guy on here who kicked his grandmother down the stairs, embezzled money from a children's hospital, and poisoned a puppy.

speaker: Martin
text: Give him credit, though, he did show up for work every day.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh dear, Dad, if you're going to be so devilishly subtle, how will I ever get your point?

speaker: Martin
text: All right, well, call me old-fashioned.  I think that when you sign a contract, you stick to it.  A man's only as good as his word.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, my words have doubled the station's ad revenues All they've shown me for thanks is a measly eight-percent raise!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, so what?  In thirty years on the police force, you think I ever went to the sergeant and said, "Hey, I'm shooting way more bad guys than I thought I would, how about a bonus?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you don't understand, this is show business--

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll get it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Daphne. [_to Martin_] You see, we do things differently.  Negotiations are like a, are like a dance. They _expect_ me to fight my contract.  They know I'm not sick.  I know they know I'm not sick.  They know I know they know I'm not sick.  It's all part of the negotiations mambo.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hi, Daphne.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Martin.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, how goes things at the front?

speaker: Roz
text: Well, for starters, they've painted over your name on your parking space.

speaker: Frasier
text: Perfect!

speaker: Daphne
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Bebe told me they might do that.  It's part of a negotiation tactic, it shows that they're getting nervous.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, they must be really jittery then, because they took your picture out of the lobby.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, Roz, they're just trying to scare me.

speaker: Martin
text: [_getting up_] And he knows they're trying to scare him, and they know that he knows they're trying to scare him, he knows that they know that he knows--

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Dad! [_to Roz_] They're just bluffing, it's like a card game.

speaker: Martin
text: Like a card game, it's like a dance -- the whole thing sounds like a weekend in Vegas.

speaker: Roz
text: You know, I would have thought they'd play games too, Frasier. But they started auditioning people to replace you.

speaker: Frasier
text: They're interviewing people?

speaker: Roz
text: All day.  And they're really hot on this woman who has some gardening show.  She calls herself "Ma Nature."  I can't work for her, Frasier, you should see her nails.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there's no need to panic, Roz.  I'm sure it's all part of the dance. _Daphne opens the door to Mike, an intern from the station, who is carrying a cardboard box._

speaker: Mike
text: Hi, Dr. Crane.  The station sent me over with your stuff. Sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God, they've cleaned out my cubicle?  Listen, Mike, you're up on all the gossip -- I mean, they're just bluffing, right?

speaker: Mike
text: I hope not.  My audition went really well. _He hands the box to Daphne and leaves.  As he goes, Bebe steps off the elevator with a bouquet of flowers._

speaker: Bebe
text: Nurse Bebe reporting for duty!  Blossoms for my little shut- in! [_drops them on top of the box in Daphne's arm_] Put these in something.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Bebe, Bebe, have you heard what's going on?  They've cleaned out my cubicle, they're auditioning other people--

speaker: Bebe
text: Marvelous!  They're resorting to cheap scare tactics!  Looks like I was right to bring this along. [_takes a bottle of champagne from her purse and holds it out to Daphne_] Chill that. _Daphne, who's still laden with the box and the flowers, grits her teeth and takes the bottle._

speaker: Bebe
text: Darling, you're looking a little pale.  Don't tell me these amateur theatrics are actually worrying you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, no, no, but the stress of not worrying is starting to get to me.  I don't know if I can take much more of this!

speaker: Bebe
text: Oh darling, if that's the way you feel, then fine! Let's get this over with!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh Frasier, it's for the best.  Really, trust me on this one.

speaker: Bebe
text: [_into phone_] Tom Duran, please.  Bebe Glaser calling. [_winks at Frasier_] Tom?  Bebe's bored! [_Frasier's eyes bulge_] You've huffed, and you've puffed, but our house is still standing! We're giving you a midnight deadline!  Either call us here at Frasier's and tell us you'll renegotiate, or we'll walk! Love ya.

speaker: Bebe
text: There.  That should make them sweat, don't you think?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_wiping his own brow_] It might!

speaker: Bebe
text: Well, it's all over but the waiting.  Canasta, anyone? [_takes a pack of cards from her purse and hands them to Daphne_] Shuffle these. _Daphne, who has just finished putting the flowers in water, has had just about enough.  FADE TO:  Scene Three -- Frasier's Apartment It's almost midnight.  Roz has left.  Martin is reading the paper in his Armchair.  Bebe sits at the dinner table playing solitaire. Eddie sits in a chair, watching her.  Frasier paces the apartment with a glass of scotch. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Eleven forty-five.  Oh, God.  It's over.  They've made the decision, it's over.  Well, it was a fun run while it lasted, eh, Seattle? [_opens the balcony door_] This is Dr. Frasier Crane!  And I _was_ listening!

speaker: Daphne
text: Here we are!  One cup of tea -- half Darjeeling, half Chamomile, skim milk, a packet of sweetener -- oh, and I thought you might enjoy a nice fat-free tea biscuit. Will there be anything else?

speaker: Bebe
text: No.  You run along, I'm fine.

speaker: Daphne
text: You're sure now?  Because I could wait until you finish the biscuit and floss your teeth for you.

speaker: Bebe
text: You are a cheeky little monkey, aren't you? [_bites the tea biscuit_] This cookie tastes like meat!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, and it'll remove tartar, and give you a nice, shiny coat. _She tosses another biscuit to Eddie and exits, triumphant. Bebe disgustedly tosses the rest of hers to Eddie._

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I think I'm gonna hit the hay too.

speaker: Bebe
text: That's awfully risky of you, isn't it?  Leaving us kids out here un-chaperoned?

speaker: Martin
text: Better him than me. _Martin exits, followed by Eddie.  Frasier sinks onto the couch. Bebe leans over behind him and massages his shoulders._

speaker: Bebe
text: Why are you so tense?  This is the best part!  What could be more fun than this?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, watching a loved one be autopsied?

speaker: Bebe
text: Think of them sweating in their offices -- chain-smoking, biting their nails, their ulcers churning out enough acid to burn a hole in a ship's hull! [_orgasmic_] Ooh, God! And to think I nearly went into nursing.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you're right, Bebe, you're right!  My God, if they're foolish enough to let me go, well then, fine!  There are any number of other stations that would love to have Frasier Crane on board!

speaker: Bebe
text: Exactly!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.  But you know, in fact, I think it's time maybe we discussed those other offers, consider what our fallback position should be.

speaker: Bebe
text: Ooh, someone's out of Scotch!

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe... tell me there are other offers.

speaker: Bebe
text: Scads!

speaker: Frasier
text: Now you look me in the eye and tell me the truth!

speaker: Bebe
text: [_looks him in the eye_] There are no other offers.  Straight up, or on the rocks?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_breaking down_] Oh my God!

speaker: Bebe
text: Darling, you can't make a deal without bluffing a little!

speaker: Frasier
text: You're supposed to bluff them, not me!  My God, woman, are you trying to ruin me?!

speaker: Bebe
text: You are such a worrywart! _Frasier grabs her by the arms, pulls her out of her chair and pushes her toward the phone._

speaker: Frasier
text: Now don't you patronize me, you sweet-talking succubus!  You get on the phone and call them!

speaker: Bebe
text: Ooh my God, Hands of Hercules!  What must your legs be like? _Frasier is speechless -- then the phone rings. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Answer it.

speaker: Bebe
text: Not yet. [_rings a second time_] Where are we?  Have we gone out? [_rings a third time_] Is it too late?

speaker: Frasier
text: ANSWER IT!

speaker: Bebe
text: [_picks up_] Crane residence, Bebe Glaser speaking. [_whispers_] It's them. [_into phone_]  I see.  I see.  Fine.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well?

speaker: Bebe
text: Renegotiations tomorrow, starting from scratch! _Frasier collapses with relief.  Bebe takes the champagne bottle from an ice bucket on the coffee table._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!  Oh, dear God!  Oh, we did it!  Oh my God, I'm so pleased. Thank you, Bebe.

speaker: Bebe
text: Maybe next time you'll trust little Bebe.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, oh, I'm so sorry, you're right, I underestimated you. I'm sorry.  I'm sorry for that horrible outburst and for grabbing you the way I did.

speaker: Bebe
text: Don't be.  I was impressed.  It was manly in a... hysterical sort of way.

speaker: Bebe
text: Cheers.

speaker: Frasier
text: Champagne, on top of scotch?  Oh, what the hell.

speaker: Bebe
text: To a beautiful partnership.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no -- to a remarkable agent. [_they clink glasses and sip_] What Bebe wants, Bebe gets.  When will I ever learn that?

speaker: Bebe
text: Soon enough, dear.

speaker: Bebe
text: Soon enough. _END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four -- Frasier's Apartment Frasier lies asleep on the couch in his dressing gown.  Eddie is perched on the couch above him, staring at him.  The room is strewn with discarded shoes, Kleenex, Alka-Seltzer, and several bottles of champagne.  Martin comes out, sees Frasier, and peels open one of his eyelids. Frasier starts awake. _

speaker: Martin
text: Sorry, Eddie, he's still alive.  You're not gonna get your own room after all.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh God...

speaker: Martin
text: How're you feeling?

speaker: Frasier
text: How do I look?

speaker: Martin
text: Last time I saw a guy who looked like you, he'd been in the trunk of a car at the airport for a month.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good morning! [_sees the bottles_] My goodness!  Christened a few ships last night, I see.

speaker: Frasier
text: The station agreed to renegotiate.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, all right!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, marvelous!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, they called around five to midnight... and Bebe and I had some champagne to celebrate, and then... and then... Oh, God.

speaker: Bebe
text: Morning, Doctor. _Bebe appears from the hall.  She's wearing Frasier's shirt from the night before, and nothing else except her underwear, heels, and a dreamy smile.  The sight and sound is enough to make Martin yelp and stumble backwards, nearly dropping the paper._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_in a small, frightened voice_] Somebody hold me.

speaker: Bebe
text: I hope you don't mind, but I didn't see a robe, and your shirt looked so nice and big and warm -- just like you.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, I think I'll go in the other room and eat my breakfast -- while I still can!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'd better go cook for him.  I know how the Crane men like their legs. [_off Bebe's sharp look_] -- eggs!

speaker: Bebe
text: I think they're a little shocked!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I'm, I'm a little surprised myself.

speaker: Bebe
text: Oh, let's not kid ourselves.  We both knew this would happen someday.

speaker: Frasier
text: We did?

speaker: Bebe
text: The signs were all there -- the glances, the furtive smiles...

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, you know what would really hit the spot right now?

speaker: Bebe
text: My God, you're a machine!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gesturing "No, not that!"_] Coffee!  I meant coffee.

speaker: Bebe
text: I'll get it.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no no no, that's not necessary--

speaker: Bebe
text: Good morning, Niles!  What a lovely surprise!  We were just about to sit down to a big family breakfast.  Won't you join us? _Niles stares for a second, then tries to bypass her by emphatically pressing the doorbell again._

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on in, Niles, it's all right.

speaker: Frasier
text: We were celebrating.  You see, the station called to renegotiate my contract.

speaker: Niles
text: Ah.  Paid your commission up-front, I see.

speaker: Bebe
text: It's getting late, I'd better go freshen up.  Save me a muffin, Muffin!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, all right, just go ahead, get your shots in!

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  I'm just glad your all right.  I would have assumed she killed after mating.

speaker: Martin
text: Is she gone?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Dad, she's--she's changing.  Oh my God, how did this happen?

speaker: Niles
text: You're asking _us_?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I've got to talk with her, I've got to tell her this was all just a mistake.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, you'd better be careful how you let her down.  She's liable to go nuts -- like in that movie -- then sneak in here and try to boil Eddie!  [_N.B. -- "Fatal Attraction."_]

speaker: Martin
text: Well, look, we'll clear out of here and give you a little privacy.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, Dad, I can't tell her right now.  She's about to go down there and renegotiate my contract.  I'll tell her later.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, that's a good idea -- wait till she makes you a bunch of money, then on top of breaking her heart you can make her feel really used.

speaker: Daphne
text: Sounds like a plan to me.

speaker: Bebe
text: [_o.s._] Darling!

speaker: Niles
text: We'll leave you to your happy task. _Daphne, Niles, and Martin exit to the kitchen.  As they go, Martin signals to Frasier, urging him to get it over with.  Bebe comes out dressed in her suit._

speaker: Bebe
text: Cancel that muffin.  Bebe just started a diet -- Wink! Besides, tonight we're dining at Bernardi's.  It's sinfully expensive, but I think after contract talks we can afford it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, Bebe--

speaker: Bebe
text: Yeeeeessss?

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, um, I don't think there are any words to describe what we shared last night...

speaker: Bebe
text: It was like... Greco-Roman wrestling on a trampoline.

speaker: Frasier
text: You see, I- as magical as it was, I --I don't think it's the kind of thing we should let happen again.

speaker: Bebe
text: [_laughing_] Ooh!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you see, I value you too much as a colleague to do anything that might jeopardize that relationship.

speaker: Bebe
text: [_smile disappears_] I see.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, you're upset.

speaker: Bebe
text: No, I'm sure we both would have realized it was a mistake sooner or later.  Personally, I was hoping for later but I suppose sooner's is best.

speaker: Frasier
text: It is, it really is.

speaker: Bebe
text: I'd better dash, I'll call you after the meeting.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, like you never crawled under the wrong fence once in your life! **IT'S LIKE SWAN LAKE, ONLY DEEPER** _Scene Five -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier and Niles are seated at a table. _

speaker: Niles
text: Disaster again.  Maris's little wine club had an outing at a local vineyard.  As the new president, she had the honor of being first into the stomping vat.  You can imagine her humiliation when she danced herself into a barefoot fury and was unable to break even a single grape.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, have you heard a word I've said?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course not, Niles.  I'm still worried about Bebe.

speaker: Niles
text: I thought you said she took it well.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, she did, but you know how it is with strong women. Sometimes their strength masks their vulnerability.  Well, let's face it.  Once a woman has dipped her toe into Crane Lake, dry land is never the same again.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, she's probably home in her room writing "Mrs. Bebe Crane" over and over in the margin of her algebra book.

speaker: Frasier
text: You can make light of this if you want to, but it is entirely possible that I broke that woman's heart!

speaker: Roz
text: Who?  Whose heart did you break?

speaker: Frasier
text: No one! [_Niles opens his mouth_] Niles, be quiet!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, come on, Frasier!  I'm gonna figure it out sooner or later.  Come on, give me a clue, just one, that's all I need. _Bulldog tears into the Caf e. _

speaker: Bulldog
text: Doc!  Doc!  Come quick!  Bebe's out on the ledge of our building, she's threatening to jump!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God!  This is all my fault!

speaker: Roz
text: Wait!  Just give me a hint! _Roz runs after them.  Niles gets up to follow, but a waiter sticks him with the check._FADE TO:_ Scene Six -- Tom's Office The KACL station manager's office.  Bebe is standing on the window ledge.  Tom Duran (last seen in [[1.09]](/frasier/transcripts/season_1/episode_9/selling_out.html "Selling Out"), "The Matchmaker") is leaning out the window, trying to talk her in. _

speaker: Tom
text: Bebe, please...

speaker: Bebe
text: [_hysterical_] Get away from me!

speaker: Frasier
text: What happened?

speaker: Tom
text: I don't know.  We were working on your deal, and she just burst into tears.  I went out to get some water for her. When I came back, she's standing out there, sobbing that she doesn't want to live!

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, it's Frasier.  Please come in.

speaker: Bebe
text: [_hysterical_] It's no good!  My life is over!

speaker: Bulldog
text: You got to save her, Doc.  My contract's up in six weeks, she's my agent too.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, I'm going out there.

speaker: Roz
text: Are you nuts?  That's nine stories down!  You know what a drop like that would do to you?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, Roz, why don't you toss a pumpkin out the window so I have a clear image just before I try?!

speaker: Tom
text: Why don't we just wait for the police?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no!  No, that woman out there needs me.  Bebe, I'm coming out.

speaker: Bebe
text: Don't come any closer!  I'll jump!

speaker: Frasier
text: Bebe, please--

speaker: Bebe
text: No, you can't help me!  No one can help me!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm not worth doing this over.  Look, there'll be other men. It may take time, but you'll get over me.

speaker: Bebe
text: [_normal voice_] Well, somebody certainly thinks well of himself.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Bebe
text: Darling, this isn't about us!  It's just a little bargaining tactic.

speaker: Bebe
text: I threaten to jump, you talk me down, major coverage -- bang, your price goes up twenty percent! [_hysterical_] My life is meaningless! [_normal_] Talk to me, darling, talk to me!

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you out of your mind?  Now listen, you're coming in, you're coming in right now!

speaker: Bebe
text: [_hysterical_] Get away from me!  You can't talk me out of this! [_normal_] At least not until Channel Five gets here. Now come on, dear, make like a therapist!

speaker: Frasier
text: God, you _are_ out of your mind!  You-you need help, you should be in therapy!

speaker: Bebe
text: That's good, but louder. [_hysterical_] Give me one reason to live!  Just one! _She pauses, and gives him a look that says "Well, come on!" Frasier tries playing along._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_shouting_] There are... hundreds of reasons!  Work!  Art! The people who care about you! [_lowers voice_] Now come in, you crazy bitch! _Bebe just gives him a look.  Frasier cringes -- he's just seen the face of the Devil.  A helicopter approaches the building. _

speaker: Bebe
text: Channel Five, come to Mama!  Okay, dear.  Full coverage -- now here's the plan: I swoon forward, you reach out and catch me.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Bebe
text: On three.  One, two...

speaker: Frasier
text: No!

speaker: Bebe
text: THREE! _Bebe throws herself forward.  Frasier lunges to catch her.  Everyone in the office screams.  Frasier teeters dangerously on the ledge for a second, then pulls Bebe back to the window with his arms around her waist.  She flashes a grin at the helicopter._

speaker: Bebe
text: Film at eleven.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, God... Oh God... just get in.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, Bebe, are you all right?

speaker: Bebe
text: [_shaken_] Yes... I'm fine now.

speaker: Roz
text: Bulldog, get her some water.  You want to sit down? _Bulldog exits.  Roz and Tom sit Bebe down in a chair.  She looks over at Frasier._

speaker: Bebe
text: Thank you, Frasier.  You saved my life.

speaker: Tom
text: That was incredible, Frasier.  Look, uh, I know we've got some unfinished business.  But, rest assured, after this, there's no way we're gonna let you get away.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... thank you, Tom.  If I could just have a moment alone with Bebe?

speaker: Roz
text: Sure. _Roz and Tom leave the office and close the door.  Bebe still has her head lowered._

speaker: Frasier
text: What kind of a woman are you?  You seduced me, you lied to me, you nearly got me killed!  You've shamelessly manipulated not only me, but this station, the news media, and the entire city of Seattle!  What do you have to say for yourself?!

speaker: Bebe
text: Aren't you glad I'm on your side? _Frasier backs away in horror -- then considers the question. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I... suppose I am.
